frame.name: Agree_or_refuse_to_act
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Speaker</fen> either agrees to or refuses to engage in a <fen>Proposed_action</fen>, proposed by an <fen>Interlocutor</fen>. <ex></ex> <ex><fex name="Speaker">They</fex> <t>agreed</t> <fex name="pro">to express their outrage with editorials in today's paper</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Speaker">The man's</fex> <t>refusal</t> <fex name="pro">to accept blood</fex> severely hampered his treatment after the car accident.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Speaker
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the person to whom a particular action has been proposed and who responds to the request or offer made. </def-root>

FE.name: Interlocutor
FE.definition: <def-root>This is the person who proposed the <fen>Proposed_action</fen> to the <fen>Speaker</fen> and to whom the <fen>Speaker</fen> communicates their response. </def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root>As with <fen>Medium</fen> in other communication frames, the physical entity or channel used to communicate can be expressed.</def-root>

FE.name: Proposed_action
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Proposed_action</fen> is an action that the <fen>Speaker</fen> would perform if they were to accept or refuse the request or offer.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly</ment>, <ment>loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). It may indicate salient characteristics of the <fen>Speaker</fen> that affect the action (<ment>presumptuously</ment>, <ment>coldly</ment>, <ment>deliberately</ment>, <ment>eagerly</ment>). </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Speaker</fen> responds to the request or offer made. </def-root>

FE.name: Internal_cause
FE.definition:
<def-root>The response may be prompted by either some outside phenomenon or occurrence, or by an <fen>Internal_cause</fen>, the <fen>Speaker</fen> mental or emotional state.
</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen> gives their verbal response to the proposed action.
</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes their verbal response concerning the proposed action.
</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>An action that the <fen>Speaker</fen> intends to accomplish by agreeing or refusing to perform the <fen>Proposed_action</fen> that is requested of, or suggested to them.
</def-root>

FE.name: Particular_iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of response events. </def-root>

FE.name: Role
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Role</fen> denotes the status that the <fen>Interlocutor</fen> requested to be granted.
<ex>A serious injustice was committed by Citizenship and Immigration Canada (CIC) when it <t>refused</t> her <fex name="Role">as a political refugee</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Co-timed_event
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the subevent of the agreeing/refusing to act. </def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>The number of times (within a given period) that the agreeing/refusing to act occurs. </def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the <fen>Explanation</fen> causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. </def-root>

FE.name: Event_description
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE applies to appraisals of the event, typically a judgment of its expectedness, and consists of any descriptions of the state of affairs denoted by the target as role fillers in other frames. The state of affairs reported by the target is understood to play a role in the state of affairs of the modifier.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: refuse.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: indicate unwillingness to accept or grant (something offered or requested)

lexUnit.name: refusal.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the action of indicating unwillingness to accept or grant (something offered or requested).
